name: Feroxbuster - recursive web content discovery
description: Feroxbuster is a fast, recursive web content discovery tool. These examples demonstrate varying performance and wordlist choices for directory/file discovery on HTTP services and saving results to files.

commands.name: Basic folder scan
commands.command: feroxbuster -u http://{TARGET}:8080/ --scan-dir-listings --threads 50 -r -o 8080-ferox-{TARGET}.txt -x pdf -x js,html -x php txt json,docx
commands.description: Recursive scan of `{TARGET}` using a broad set of file extensions; moderate threading (20) and DirB wordlist. Results saved to `80-ferox-{TARGET}.txt`.

commands.name: Basic recursive scan with common extensions (templated target)
commands.description: Recursive scan of `{TARGET}` using a broad set of file extensions; moderate threading (20) and DirB wordlist. Results saved to `80-ferox-{TARGET}.txt`.

commands.name: High-throughput scan using large Seclists wordlist
commands.description: High-speed enumeration against `$IP` using the Raft large directories wordlist and 100 threads; output saved under `enum/` folder.

commands.name: Comprehensive extension set for deep enumeration (RHOST templated)
commands.description: Deep recursive scan against `$RHOST` with an expanded set of extensions (including binary/document extensions) and a large wordlist; useful when targets may host varied file types. Results saved to `enum/80-ferox-$RHOST.txt`.
